Pros of working in a group

Working in small groups gives ground for more ideas,
because there are more people that can contribute.
People are also good at different things, which means
all participants can contribute more in certain aspects of a specific task.

Working becomes more effective since more people work on the
same task at once. This means we spare more time and get
more things done in a specific time window.

Working in groups is essential for constructive criticism,
which again is important for self-growth and getting
different perspectives at many things and ideas.

Cons of working in a group

Working in groups can often make people distracted, because there is a lot going on.
Bias can also occur between people, if someone does not like one another.

Sometimes it may be hard to be heard across many people, which
means some people can be more or less ignored or not given enough attention.
Some people will in consequence say more, while others will still have something to say but wonâ€™t be able to

Time waste may occur due to small things like finding a group room,
technical difficulties or simply people not being on time or not having enough time.
